quoteText: I like living. I have sometimes been wildly, despairingly, acutely miserable, racked with sorrow; but through it all I still know quite certainly that just to be alive is a grand thing.
Courage is the price that life exacts for granting peace.
Never do things others can do and will do, if there are things others cannot do or will not do.
The most difficult thing is the decision to act, the rest is merely tenacity.
The most effective way to do it, is to do it.
Women must try to do things as men have tried. When they fail their failure must be but a challenge to others.
And the day came when the risk to remain tight in a bud was more painful than the risk it took to blossom.
We don't see things as they are, we see them as we are.
A good compromise is one where everybody makes a contribution.
If you don't get out of the box you've been raised in, you won't understand how much bigger the world is.
Don't look at your feet to see if you are doing it right. Just dance.

I have stood on a mountain of no's for one yes.

If you can't go straight ahead, you go around the corner.

If you don't like the road you're walking, start paving another one.

If you don't risk anything, you risk even more.

Be first and be lonely.
Dying seems less sad than having lived too little.
The first problem for all of us, men and women, is not to learn, but to unlearn.

Many receive advice, only the wise profit from it.
Alone we can do so little; together we can do so much.
Life is either a great adventure or nothing.
Optimism is the faith that leads to achievement.
Remember, no effort that we make to attain something beautiful is ever lost.
What I am looking for is not out there, it is in me.
What I am looking for is not out there, it is in me.
When one door of happiness closes, another opens; but often we look so long at the closed door that we do not see the one which has been opened for us.
